[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m626[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m23 | [0m[35m        generate_purl(product, version, vendor):[0m

[30;1m25 | [0m[35m        run_checker(filename):[0m

[30;1m302 | [0m[35m## How it works[0m
[30;1m303 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m304 | [0m[35mThis scanner looks at the strings found in binary files to see if they[0m
[30;1m305 | [0m[35mmatch vulnerable versions of a small set of popular open source libraries.[0m
[30;1m306 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m307 | [0m[35mIt only matches strings that are of length 3+; this allows the tool to handle versions[0m

[30;1m1350 | [0m[35mAs the name implies, quiet mode has no console output, and one must check the[0m
[30;1m1351 | [0m[35mreturn code to see if any issues were found. The return value will be the number of files that have [0m
[30;1m1352 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1353 | [0m[35mBelow is what it returns on bash when one file is found to have CVEs:[0m
[30;1m1354 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1355 | [0m[35m```console[0m
[30;1m1356 | [0m[35mterri@sandia:~/Code/cve-bin-tool$ cve-bin-tool -q ~/output_test_quiet/openssl[0m

[30;1m1200 | [0m[35msuch as images, can be embedded in them, and thus anyone viewing a PDF could[0m
[30;1m1201 | [0m[35mload an external image (similar to how viewing a web page can trigger external[0m
[30;1m1202 | [0m[35mloads). There's no inherent "fix" for that, only mitigations where users of[0m

[30;1m968 | [0m[35m- a system using pacman package manager by running `pacman -Qqe > pkg-list`[0m
[30;1m969 | [0m[35m- a system using rpm package manager by running `rpm -qa --queryformat '%{NAME}\n' > pkg-list`[0m
[30;1m970 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m971 | [0m[35min the terminal and provide it as an input by running `cve-bin-tool -L pkg-list` for a full package [0m
[30;1m972 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m82 | [0m[35m## Most popular usage options[0m
[30;1m83 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m84 | [0m[35m### Finding known vulnerabilities using the binary scanner[0m
[30;1m85 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m86 | [0m[35mTo run the binary scanner on a directory or file:[0m
[30;1m87 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m88 | [0m[35m```bash[0m

   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/cve_bin_tool-3.4/doc/CHECKERS.md[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m182 | [0m[35mavoid false positives.[0m
[30;1m183 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m184 | [0m[35mIt's also worth noting that sometimes there just aren't great version strings[0m
[30;1m185 | [0m[35mavailable: sometimes `X.X.X` is all you can find.  If you get stuck at this[0m
[30;1m186 | [0m[35mpoint, please make a note of it in the[0m
[30;1m187 | [0m[35m[New Checker](https://github.com/intel/cve-bin-tool/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+%22[0m
[30;1m188 | [0m[35missue if there is one. (You can make a new one and note it there if there isn't.)[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1042[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Windows[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(advpack\.dll|appvlp|at|atbroker|bash|bginfo|bitsadmin|cdb|certutil|cl_invocation\.ps1|cl_mutexverifiers\.ps1|cmd|cmdkey|cmstp|comsvcs\.dll|control|csc|cscript|csi|devtoolslauncher|dfsvc|diskshadow|dnscmd|dnx|dotnet|dxcap|esentutl|eventvwr|excel|expand|extexport|extrac32|findstr|forfiles|ftp|gfxdownloadwrapper|gpscript|hh|ie4uinit|ieadvpack\.dll|ieaframe\.dll|ic|infdefaultinstall|installutil|jsc|makecab|manage-bde\.wsf|mavinject|mftrace|microsoft\.workflow\.compiler|mmc|msbuild|msconfig|msdeploy|msdt|mshta|mshtml\.dll|msc|msxsl|netsh|odbcconf|pcalua|pcwrun|pcwutl\.dll|pester\.bat|powerpnt|presentationhost|pubprn\.vbs|rcsi|reg|regasm|regedit|register-cimprovider|regsvcs|regsvr32|rpcping|rundll32|runonce|runscripthelper|sc|schtasks|scriptrunner|setupapi\.dll|shdocvw\.dll|shell32\.dll|slmgr\.vbs|sqldumper|sqlps|sqltoolsps|squirrel|syncappvpublishingserver|syncappvpublishingserver\.vbs|syssetup\.dll|te|tracker|tttracer|update|url\.dll|verclsid|vsjitdebugger|wab|winrm\.vbs|winword|wmic|wscript|wsl|wsreset|xwizard|zipfldr\.dll)\s[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m- If you don't have a copy, browse through the source to find the version string. It's usually[0m
[30;1m126 | [0m[35m  helpfully named something like 'version' so a quick grep/search often will turn it up, and[0m
[30;1m127 | [0m[35m  if you know the latest version number (usually proudly mentioned in the latest news post[0m
[30;1m128 | [0m[35m  or similar) you can grep for that and then look at the history to see what valid patterns[0m
[30;1m129 | [0m[35m  look like.[0m
[30;1m130 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35m### Multi-line version patterns[0m

[30;1m111 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m112 | [0m[35mYou can get a basic idea of the pattern from looking at the project's documentation/website[0m
[30;1m113 | [0m[35mor use [cvedetails](https://www.cvedetails.com/) since it catalogs vulnerable versions and[0m
[30;1m114 | [0m[35mthus has version lists. Once you know what the version numbers look like, you'll need to[0m
[30;1m115 | [0m[35mfind them in the code or the binary itself to make sure you've got a findable pattern.[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m

[30;1m390 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m336 | [0m[35mdatabase of the NVD using a CVE you want to know the vendor product pair(s) for.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1067[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m

       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/cve_bin_tool-3.4/doc/CHECKERS.md[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m319 | [0m[35m> In the case of libvorbis the versions containing[0m
[30;1m320 | [0m[35m> [CVEs](https://www.cvedetails.com/product/11738/Libvorbis-Libvorbis.html?vendor_id=6970)[0m
[30;1m321 | [0m[35m> are 1.2.0 and below. The `.rpm` we used for this example was from version[0m
[30;1m322 | [0m[35m> 1.3.7. While this was a nice example for how one might find a signature, it[0m
[30;1m323 | [0m[35m> in the end is not all the work that is needed to create a checker for[0m
[30;1m324 | [0m[35m> libvorbis. We need to make sure that any checker we develop has a[0m
[30;1m325 | [0m[35m> `get_version()` function which works for versions of the software which have[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1068[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1069[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/cve_bin_tool-3.4/doc/CHECKERS.md[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m312 | [0m[35m> If you can't get a signature match using just regex you may end up needing to[0m
[30;1m313 | [0m[35m> overwrite the[0m
[30;1m314 | [0m[35m> [`get_version()`](https://github.com/intel/cve-bin-tool/blob/main/cve_bin_tool/checkers/__init__.p[0m
[30;1m315 | [0m[35m> method for the checker, but that should be a last resort if you can't find a[0m
[30;1m316 | [0m[35m> regex that works for `VERSION_PATTERNS`.[0m
[30;1m317 | [0m[35m>[0m
[30;1m318 | [0m[35m> A note about this example:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1070[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/cve_bin_tool-3.4/doc/CHECKERS.md[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m296 | [0m[35mYou also might want to look for the version number. In this case it's `1.3.7`.[0m
[30;1m297 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m298 | [0m[35m```console[0m
[30;1m299 | [0m[35m$ strings $(cat executables.txt) | sort | uniq | grep -i 1.3.7[0m
[30;1m300 | [0m[35m3?Xiph.Org libVorbis 1.3.7[0m
[30;1m301 | [0m[35mlibvorbisenc.so.2.0.12-1.3.7-2.fc33.x86_64.debug[0m
[30;1m302 | [0m[35mlibvorbisfile.so.3.3.8-1.3.7-2.fc33.x86_64.debug[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1071[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/cve_bin_tool-3.4/doc/CHECKERS.md[0m

[30;1m236 | [0m[35mor using [rpmfile](https://pypi.org/project/rpmfile/). Sometimes you'll have[0m

[30;1m238 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m223 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m224 | [0m[35m### Quickstart for finding patterns[0m
[30;1m225 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m226 | [0m[35mWhat often helps is trying to find an `.rpm` (or more than one) or a package[0m
[30;1m227 | [0m[35mwhich contains the product you're looking for.[0m
[30;1m228 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m229 | [0m[35mSearching on <https://pkgs.org> is a good place to start.[0m

[30;1m213 | [0m[35mfor this, or other tools for other repositories). `CONTAINS_PATTERNS` field supports[0m

[30;1m176 | [0m[35mSo a good regex signature for libcurl might be `r"curl[ -/]([678]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+)"`[0m
[30;1m177 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m178 | [0m[35mThe whole point of the CVE Binary Tool is to detect libraries that you might not[0m
[30;1m179 | [0m[35mknow are there, so we'd expect it often to be used on binaries that have a lot[0m
[30;1m180 | [0m[35mof libraries compiled into them.  Finding a regex that detects only what you[0m
[30;1m181 | [0m[35mcare about even in the face of a lot of similar strings is essential for us to[0m
[30;1m182 | [0m[35mavoid false positives.[0m

[30;1m119 | [0m[35m- The CVE Binary tool basically works by running the command line utility `strings` on a file,[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m  so if you have a local copy of the library, you can run `strings $libraryname` and see what[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m  comes out.  try `strings $libraryname | grep $version` and see what you find, and if you[0m
[30;1m122 | [0m[35m  don't find it that way `strings $libraryname | less` and page through (maybe run a filter[0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35m  in there so it's only strings over a certain size?)[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m- If you don't have a copy, browse through the source to find the version string. It's usually[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m- The CVE Binary tool basically works by running the command line utility `strings` on a file,[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m  so if you have a local copy of the library, you can run `strings $libraryname` and see what[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m  comes out.  try `strings $libraryname | grep $version` and see what you find, and if you[0m
[30;1m122 | [0m[35m  don't find it that way `strings $libraryname | less` and page through (maybe run a filter[0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35m  in there so it's only strings over a certain size?)[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1092[0m[34m of [0m[33m1509[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m111 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m112 | [0m[35mYou can get a basic idea of the pattern from looking at the project's documentation/website[0m
[30;1m113 | [0m[35mor use [cvedetails](https://www.cvedetails.com/) since it catalogs vulnerable versions and[0m
[30;1m114 | [0m[35mthus has version lists. Once you know what the version numbers look like, you'll need to[0m
[30;1m115 | [0m[35mfind them in the code or the binary itself to make sure you've got a findable pattern.[0m
[30;1m116 | [0m[35m[0m

   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35mInside the `get_cve_data()` function, you want to download the your data and stick it in the `.cache[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m4. You will also need to set `self.source_name` in `__init__`.[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m## 2. Add the new data source to cli.py as a source[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35mThere are two places in `cli.py` where you need to make changes.  One is to add the source as an imp[0m
[30;1m  | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m203 | [0m[35msuch as images, can be embedded in them, and thus anyone viewing a PDF could[0m
[30;1m204 | [0m[35mload an external image (similar to how viewing a web page can trigger external[0m
[30;1m205 | [0m[35mloads). There's no inherent "fix" for that, only mitigations where users of[0m
[30;1m206 | [0m[35mthe library must ensure only expected items are added to PDFs at the time of[0m
[30;1m207 | [0m[35mgeneration.[0m
[30;1m208 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m209 | [0m[35mSince users may not want to have software installed with an open, unfixable CVE[0m

[30;1m258 | [0m[35msuch as images, can be embedded in them, and thus anyone viewing a PDF could[0m
[30;1m259 | [0m[35mload an external image (similar to how viewing a web page can trigger external[0m
[30;1m260 | [0m[35mloads). There's no inherent "fix" for that, only mitigations where users of[0m
[30;1m261 | [0m[35mthe library must ensure only expected items are added to PDFs at the time of[0m
[30;1m262 | [0m[35mgeneration.[0m
[30;1m263 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m264 | [0m[35mSince users may not want to have software installed with an open, unfixable CVE[0m

[30;1m83 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m84 | [0m[35m1. Download CVE Data (from NVD, Redhat, OSV, Gitlab, and Curl).[0m
[30;1m85 | [0m[35m   - This happens once per day by default, not every time a scan is run.[0m
[30;1m86 | [0m[35m   - On first run, downloading all data can take some time.[0m

[30;1m88 | [0m[35m   1. Creates a component list (including versions) using a combination of binary checkers and langu[0m

[30;1m258 | [0m[35msuch as images, can be embedded in them, and thus anyone viewing a PDF could[0m
[30;1m259 | [0m[35mload an external image (similar to how viewing a web page can trigger external[0m
[30;1m260 | [0m[35mloads). There's no inherent "fix" for that, only mitigations where users of[0m
[30;1m261 | [0m[35mthe library must ensure only expected items are added to PDFs at the time of[0m
[30;1m262 | [0m[35mgeneration.[0m
